title: Rock Creek Park: People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People               People        Many People have made contribution to the development of Rock Creek Park.  Â    People significant to the development of Meridian Hill Park. George Burnap was the designer of the first plan for Meridian Hill Park. John J. Earley developed the process for producing the exposed aggregate concrete that gives Meridian Hill Park its unique character.  Horace Peaslee was the primary architect for Meridian Hill Park from 1917 to 1935. He played the most influential role in the development of the park.  Ferruccio Vitale was the chief designer for the planting plan, and later as a member of the Commission of Fine Arts, he played an integral role in the design and development of the park. Mary Henderson lobbied Congress in support of the acquisition of the land and its development as a park.
